TopicTitle: How does the Re-Entry heat mechanic work exactly??

Articles.Content:
So I just started my career up, its been a while and I know they have added re-entry heat to be deadly.. so all I see are the ablative heat shields... what do we use for space planes and not capsule type rockets??

Also on that note, I had a probe come in at a really shallow angle at something like 2300 meters per second on Kerbin and it lit up the heat shield for a good 5 minutes, I mean it glowed orange to white hot... except the ablative never depleted??? Im curious, shouldn't it have gone down?? 

I just am having trouble understanding how the mechanic works is all.. any help would be appreciated.

In stock 1.0.2, re-entry heat is massively underpowered (see [this thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118785) for testing), but for future reference (or if you want to use the [reentry heat rebalance](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/119308) mod) airbrakes work pretty well for spaceplanes and rockets without heatshields ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). If you want, there's an option in the debug menu (alt/mod + F12 by default) to add detailed information about the heating (under physics -> thermal). It's useful for figuring out why things are overheating (or not in this case).
